meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted experiments to see if the hypothesis was falsifiable.
meanings.sent2: It is important in science to have falsifiable theories that can be tested.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so obvious, it was almost falsifiable by anyone.
meanings.sent4: Her belief in magic was as falsifiable as a house made of cards.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time travel is fascinating but not always falsifiable in reality.

meanings.definition: Capable of being shown to be incorrect.
meanings.sent1: The data presented was not falsifiable and needed further verification.
meanings.sent2: In a debate, it is crucial to provide falsifiable evidence to support your argument.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a falsifiable clue that led to the real culprit.
meanings.sent4: His alibi was as falsifiable as a sandcastle in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map turned out to be falsifiable, leading the explorers in the wrong direction.
